result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Perez

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
matter set for ptc 12/12/22 at 8:30
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: matter set for ptc 10/10/22 at 9:00

Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

10:19 AM Defendant Antonio Perez appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Antonio Perez.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
This matter is set for a bond modification hearing.
Court questions Atty Kryshak on his motion for bond modification and states his request on the record.
Court questions ADA Dodge as to what his position is; ADA Dodge would oppose the request for bond modification and states his reasons on the record.
Court questions ADA Dodge with regards to a history of non-appearance; he responds.
Atty Kryshak indicates that his client has a place to stay locally.
Court questions the address/residents as to where the defendant will be staying.
Court makes statements on the record.
Court does indicate that some cash is appropriate.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will reduce the bond to a $5,000 cash bond with same conditions.
Affidavit of Gary J Kryshak (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/30/22 sp)
Notice of Motion and Motion to Amend Bond filed by Atty Gary Kryshak (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/30/22 sp)
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:39 PM Defendant Antonio Perez in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Antonio Perez.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

3:39 p.m.  Det. Gischia is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge. 
3:40 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
No objection by Atty Kryshak.
3:45 p.m.  ADA Dodge would ask that the court take judicial notice of 18CF186.
BY THE COURT: 
Court takes judicial notice.
Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
3:48 p.m. ADA Dodge has no follow up.
Witness is excused.
Atty Kryshak has no argument.
Atty Kryshak states that he will be filing a Motion for Bond Modification and asks that this be put on for the September 19 Pre-Trial Conference date.
Atty Kryshak to file his motion prior to 09/19/22.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Answer filed by Atty Gary Kryshak (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/19/22 sp)

1:33 PM Defendant Antonio Perez in court, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Antonio Perez. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Kryshak

Adjustment Number: 22A 052575,
Payable Number: 62356,
Amount: $20.00
Initial Appearance set for August 8, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

11:14 AM Debtor Antonio Perez appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of WI.   Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of 5 Counts of Felon in Possession of a Firearm, Possession of Cocaine, Possession of  THC, Maintain Drug Trafficking Place & Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record and indicates that the defendant is employed and resides in Plover.
Court questions where his family is located; Atty Soule does not know where they are located. 
Court will set the $10,00 cash bond with conditions as stated
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
